CH0WD3R
273 produits enregistrés
0
42 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2022
I Expect You to Die 2 is a prime example of everything a franchise should aim for when making a sequel. if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

The narrative is way more thoughtful and developed than its prequel and it truly makes you believe that you are in fact a secret agent on a mission to save the entire world. While the original took you on many different settings that vastly differed from each other, this one takes you on a more cohesive one that feels more complete.

The controls are just as snappy as the original and it really makes you wish that more VR titles would adopt similar controls because they work as intended and they don't hinder the experience in any way.

To me, the puzzles felt a bit easier than the prequel but this could be the result of many factors such as me being more familiar with the franchise and the developers having more experience fine tuning their puzzles, which in return, would make them less cryptic than the original. All in all, I'll take easier thoughtful puzzles over harder bur cryptic ones.


If you loved the original, than you'll surely have an amazing time with this one.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

POPcorn
0
32 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2021
Another incredible VR experience just like the first game, an action-puzzler all from the comfort of your seat. The joy of experimenting with the environment usually squanders moments of frustration that do come with puzzle games, with few exceptions.
Though, what I particularly appreciated about this one is the unique blend of comedy and emotional investment that encompasses the style of story telling. It's definitely a mostly fun, uppity and comedic atmosphere. The game is self-aware of how cliche it is, but to also have that perfect sprinkling of seriousness that if anything helped compliment the story, especially at the end, was mind-blowing. Or maybe I just really liked the ending, and the intro, and the dialogue ("ARE YOU WEARING ONE OF MY MASKS?! XD).

I nominated this game for the "VR GAME OF THE YEAR" Steam Award!
 
TreeTrunk
1,786 produits enregistrés
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2021
I Expect You To Die 2 von Schell Games. Endlich ist die Fortsetzung eines der beliebtesten VR-Spiele der letzten Jahre auf Steam, voll mit noch mehr Superspion-Gadgets und Escape-Room-Rätseln.

I Expect You to Die 2 ändert glücklicherweise nichts an seinem Spielstil und seinen schwarzen Sinn für Humor. Wieder werden wir in den Kampf gegen den bösen Zoraxis-Konzern und seine zwielichtigen Agenten geschickt.
Ein Superoberhammerottertoastbrot! 
Une capture d'écran de I Expect You To Die 2
Par : Moriar

Wie vom ersten Teil bekannt haben wir wieder telekinetische Kräfte und anstatt zu laufen oder sich zu bücken, um Dinge aufzuheben, müssen wir nur auf ein Objekt zeigen und es heranziehen. Wir können Objekte sogar fest Schweben lassen, aber diesen Trick habe ich eigentlich gar nicht gebraucht.

In jedem der nur 6 Level werden wir, von unserem Van aus, in einem bestimmten Ort gebracht. Jetzt erhalten wir vom Boss noch nützliche zusätzliche Instruktionen und los geht der Spionageauftrag. Obwohl es Hinweise aus dem Briefing, gekritzelte Notizen und Infos über das Funkgerät gibt, lassen sich der Großteil der Rätsels einfach lösen, indem wir die Dinge in Reichweite miteinander benutzen. Die Lösungen sind meistens logisch nachzuvollziehen. Versteht man aber kein Englisch hat man es etwas schwerer, vor allem fehlt dann die tolle Story um den berühmten Schauspieler John Juniper, dem Zoraxis-Konzern und der Superschurkin The Fabricator.
Hervoragend gesprochen wird Herr Juniper von Wil Weaton ( Wesley Crusher aus Star Trek: The Next Generation).

Wie schon im ersten Teil wird unser Held unzählige Male, wie sein Name verrät, wie Phönix aus der Asche steigen, denn Sterben werden wir unweigerlich... In Schubladen können sich nützliche neue Objekte oder Informationen verbergen, aber sie können genauso gut eine scharfe Granate enthalten oder eine Axt von der Decke herabschwingen lassen...
Einen Großteil des Spaßes der I Expect You To Die Reihe entsteht ja auch gerade dadurch, auf ungewöhnliche Weise abzutreten.
Hier stehen also die Souvenirs. 
Une capture d'écran de I Expect You To Die 2
Par : Moriar

Wenn die Dinge gut laufen und wir neue Hinweise oder versteckte Fächer finden, funktioniert das Gefühl ein Superspion zu sein wirklich gut. Wenn wir aber mal nicht weiterkommen und immer wieder dieselben Aktionen durchführen müssen, nur um wieder an den Punkt zu gelangen, an dem wir nicht ganz sicher sind wie es weiter geht, kann es etwas nerven. Die Komik des Spiels macht das aber schnell wett. Es gibt zudem mehrere Gründe Level zu wiederholen, sei es um den Speedrunpreis zu bekommen oder alle im Level versteckten Souvenirs zu erlangen.
Wenn wir also erst einmal wissen, was zu tun ist, sind die sechs Level plus das kurze Tutorial in weniger als einer Stunde durchspielbar.. Sind wir das erste Mal in einem Level, dauert es natürlich dementsprechend lange herauszufinden was nun verlangt wird.
Keine Zeit verlieren und bloß nicht den Boden unter den Füßen. 
Une capture d'écran de I Expect You To Die 2
Par : Moriar

Mit einer wirklich guten Geschichte, ein nukleares Armageddon zu verhindern, ist I Expect You to Die 2 ein albernes und echt tolles Rätselspiel mit einem schwarzen Sinn für Humor.
Ich freue mich auf DLCs, oder noch besser über einen dritten Teil der Reihe.

Wer den ersten Teil mochte oder schwarz humorige Escape-Rooms liebt, ist hier genau richtig.

👀I erwarte, dass du ließt und zwar meine Reviews auf meiner Kurator Seite.

👑 Powered by HoI 4 Deu Curators group in German / English 👑

  • Follow Main group

  • Follow Second group

English:
-------------------------------->
I Expect You To Die 2 by Schell Games. Finally, the sequel to one of the most popular VR games of the last few years is on Steam, full of even more super spy gadgets and escape room puzzles.

I Expect You to Die 2 thankfully doesn't change anything about its gameplay style and black sense of humor. Once again we are sent into battle against the evil Zoraxis corporation and its shady agents.

As known from the first part, we again have telekinetic powers and instead of walking or bending down to pick things up, we just have to point at an object and pull it towards us. We can even levitate objects firmly, but I didn't really need that trick.

In each of the only 6 levels, we are taken from our van in a specific location. Now we get useful additional instructions from the boss and off we go on our spy mission. Although there are clues from the briefing, scribbled notes and info on the radio, most of the puzzles can be solved simply by using the things within reach of each other. The solutions are mostly logical to follow. If you don't understand English, however, it's a bit more difficult, especially then the great story about the famous actor John Juniper, the Zoraxis corporation and the super villain The Fabricator is missing.
Mr. Juniper is brilliantly voiced by Wil Weaton (Wesley Crusher from Star Trek: The Next Generation).

As in the first part, our hero will rise like a phoenix from the ashes countless times, as his name suggests, because dying is inevitable.... Drawers can hide useful new objects or information, but they can just as well contain a live grenade or make an axe swing down from the ceiling...
Much of the fun of the I Expect You To Die series, after all, comes from going off in unusual ways.

When things are going well and we find new clues or hidden compartments, the feeling of being a super spy works really well. But when we get stuck and have to perform the same actions over and over again, only to get back to the point where we're not quite sure how to proceed, it can get a little annoying. The comedy of the game quickly makes up for it, though. There are also several reasons to repeat levels, whether it's to get the speedrun prize or to obtain all the souvenirs hidden in the level.
So, once we know what to do, the six levels plus the short tutorial can be played through in less than an hour... If we are in a level for the first time, of course, it takes a correspondingly long time to figure out what is now required.

With a really good story of preventing a nuclear armageddon, I Expect You to Die 2 is a silly and really good puzzle game with a black sense of humor.
I look forward to DLCs, or better yet, a third installment in the series.

If you liked the first part or love blackly humorous escape rooms, this is the game for you.

👀I expect you to read and that is my reviews on my curator page.

👑 Powered by HoI 4 Deu Curators group in German / English 👑

whowe
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
12.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2021
通常意识里，特工总是专业的，凭借高科技潜入，或是靠完美的身法一招制敌。对于这个游戏⋯这些都没有。但是！躲激光，挡子弹这些可以有。
玩家哪也去不了却什么都能做。游戏给人感觉很像憨豆特工：幽默风格之下，主角不用说话就完成了一个个任务，穿越半个欧洲，在剧场里飞机上酒庄地下室一次次化险为夷。

要说最有趣的部分，那就在于它不会告诉你任务细节。相反，只是把有用的好玩的一切东西放在面前，过程中也没有一步步的指引更不会手把手去带你体验。
你看到它了，至于怎么做你来决定。这就是为什么在玩过二遍第三遍之后你还能发现一些小玩意。

非公式化的解密配上随处可见的幽默元素，再加上因为这个价格真的物超所值。玩过以后自然会发自内心地说“太精彩了”
 
Shirakami_offical

I Expect You To Die 1 and 2 are both masterclass games in what can be done with VR. They're both incredibly well polished games with a puzzle or escape room style gameplay, but there are enough hidden Easter eggs and a built in speedrun mode to keep you engaged on a replay.

Absolutely amazing, and I can't wait for the next game.

Vidéo YouTube™: I Expect You To Die 2 Review 
Vues : 363
Become an elite super spy ready for espionage, explosives, and gadgets galore. This popular escape-the-room VR franchise is back with more ingenious puzzles, cunning villains, and dangerous locales.

0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 septembre 2023
I Expect You to Die 2: Ein Agenten-Abenteuer voller Humor und Rätsel (getestet mit der Valve Index)

In I Expect You to Die 2 schlüpft der Spieler in die Rolle eines Geheimagenten, der sich in einer Reihe von gefährlichen Situationen zurechtfinden muss. Das Spiel ist ein VR-Rätselspiel, das auf dem Vorgänger I Expect You to Die aus dem Jahr 2016 basiert.

Die Geschichte von I Expect You to Die 2 beginnt mit Agent 7, der von der Geheimorganisation Zoraxis entführt wird. Zoraxis plant, die Weltherrschaft an sich zu reißen, und Agent 7 ist die einzige Hoffnung, sie zu stoppen.
Agent 7 wird in eine Reihe von tödlichen Fallen geworfen, die er nur mit seinem Verstand und seiner Geschicklichkeit überwinden kann. Er muss sich durch geheime Labore, hochmoderne Waffensysteme und sogar ein Raumschiff kämpfen, um Zoraxis zu besiegen.

Das Gameplay von I Expect You to Die 2 ist ein Mix aus Rätseln und Action. Der Spieler muss eine Reihe von Herausforderungen meistern, um zu entkommen. Dazu gehören das Lösen von Puzzles, das Manipulieren von Objekten und das Ausweichen von Gefahren.
Die Rätsel sind clever und herausfordernd, aber nie unfair. Sie erfordern ein gutes Verständnis der Spielmechaniken und ein wenig Kreativität.
Die Action-Elemente sind ebenfalls gut umgesetzt. Sie sind kurzweilig und spannend und sorgen für Abwechslung.

Die Grafik von I Expect You to Die 2 ist im Comicstil gehalten. Die Umgebungen sind detailreich und stimmig. Der Comicstil verleiht dem Spiel einen einzigartigen Charme.

Der Sound ist ebenfalls gelungen. Die Sprecher sind gut und die Musik untermalt die Atmosphäre des Spiels perfekt.

I Expect You to Die 2 ist ein sehr unterhaltsames Spiel. Das Spielprinzip ist einfach zu verstehen, aber die Rätsel sind trotzdem herausfordernd. Die Geschichte ist kurz, aber spannend und witzig.

Fazit
I Expect You to Die 2 ist ein hervorragendes VR-Rätselspiel. Das Spiel ist unterhaltsam, herausfordernd und hat eine gute Geschichte. Wer auf Rätselspiele und VR steht, sollte sich I Expect You to Die 2 unbedingt ansehen.

Gruß Ziffi
Ziffi als Steam-Kurator: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/
 
Ziffi

4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2021
Vidéo YouTube™: I Expect You To Die 2 Gameplay 
Vues : 86
From Schell Games presents I Expect You To Die 2, the sequel to I Expect You To Die. Believed to be dead from the last game, go undercover, solve puzzles and missions to foil the villains plan for...


From Schell Games presents I Expect You To Die 2, the sequel to I Expect You To Die. Believed to be dead from the last game, go undercover, solve puzzles and missions to foil the villains plan for world domination. Playing on the OG Vive headset, it is a game that is easy to control and play. It is a comfortable game as it is seated, just requires enough space to lean around the position. Though everything you need to interact with in the levels are fine enough to access and interact with. Controls at first may take a bit to getting use to with the telekinesis aspect for interacting with objects and the environment, but do get the hang of it after a bit. Controlling your two hands is very fun, bringing items towards you and away from a distance, throwing and juggling them is also neat. From food to munch, sets of disguises and the stages and levels themselves, there are a lot to interact with. The puzzles are quite fun to solve as you have to look around the area you are at, from locked drawers, coded passcodes, pictured instructions etc, you are to find out how to progress. Visually it does look really nice with all the details of the rooms and objects. The sandwich and fruit that are in your own personal mini fridge was quite delicious. Music is also a plus, with the opening credits song being extremely captivating.
Vidéo YouTube™: I Expect You To Die 2 | Opening Credits 
Vues : 1,406,608

it is a great sequel to the game, and overall a very nice vr and puzzle game.

WillSucksAtGames
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2021
<2021/08/28 追記>
約5時間程でクリア。
全6ミッションで難易度も丁度良かった。
でもラストはちょっと微妙だったな…演出は良かったが盛り上がりに欠ける。
パズルは適当にやっても一瞬で解けてしまった。

続編もありそうなので期待します。
----------------------------------
Quest2+VDにてプレイ。
警告が出ますがRift版として認識して問題無くプレイできました。
オブジェクトのハンドリングもスムーズでストレス無し。
テレキネシスは引き寄せたり離したりする以外に空中に固定できるのは良いアイデア。
メモ等固定して確認できる。

前作よりも英語が分からないとちょっとプレイはキツイかも…説明は絵が多めなので恐らく詰むことは少ないと思います。
指示については繰り返し喋ってくれますが字幕表示が無いのでちょっと分かり辛く感じた。
オプションは一切なく、キャリブレーションは起動時に行われる。

タイムラン実績数から全6面かな？意外と少ないかも。
クリア方法さえ分かってしまえば1ステージ5分も掛からない。
ボリュームは少ないかもしれない。

ゲームは面白いのでお勧めはしますが意外と人を選ぶゲームかも。
前作が気に入ったなら購入してみても良いと思いますがセールを待っても良いかと思います。
 
doh

Me and my sibling are in love with this series and are playing back and forth. Although a 3rd IEYTD might not be possible, I would not be dissapointed if they made a third. Amazing job Schell Games you've done it again!

aReo

9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2021
I HIGHLY suggest you play the original before this one. it's not that expensive and it does help the story a bit.
If you played the first game and did not like it. you will probably not like this one either
Now if you have played the first game and enjoyed it. then this game is for you. This is a completely worthy sequel to IEYTD. All the missions are a little better connected and the story is overall better than the first, the visuals are just as nice if not nicer. There are new gameplay mechanics, especially in the first and the 3rd last mission.
This is of course also a cheap vr game, so the length is nothing to brag about. I got through the main story with multiple failures within 3 hours.
Bugs there are, few, but there are bugs, though the bugs are somewhat expected of a vr game. just items clipping into eachother and sometimes not interacting with eachother properly.(the game has also been out for just a few hours so I mean it really isn't that bad)


I will update this review if I ever 100% IEYTD2.

Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2021
더 멋진 인트로, 영화같은 연출에 더해 역시나 VR에 맞는 다양한 상호작용과 다양한 문제해법이 재밌었다

스토리는 이어지지만 살짝 유머러스한 옴니버스 방탈출에 가까웠던 전작과 달리

큰 줄기의 메인스토리를 따라가고 살짝 더 진지한 분위기로 진행되며 후반부 연출은 빅감동


하지만 이번작도 로컬라이징을 염두하지 않고 제작된탓에

영어만으로 진행해야해서 간단했을 퍼즐조차 몇번이고 헤매게 되는게 아쉬웠다

Doğaçlamacı
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2021
是一款好游戏，更是一部好电影

“特工，你不能这样做，这太危险了。特工？特工！”
这款游戏并不是我曾经看着标题望文生义的那样，我曾经以为它是一部猎奇的花样作死游戏，直到昨天入下载了demo，我才发现我完全错了。在系列游戏中，玩家将扮演一名特工，在世界各地各种场景下在通讯员的指示下死里逃生化险为夷。在这个过程中作为玩家必然会经历多次失败，才有了标题里的I Expect You To Die。
游戏不支持中文，但英语难度也并不高，想要畅玩估计需要小学-初中之间的水平，你也可以下载demo尝试明白通讯员想要传达的信息。
通讯员是一个多愁善感并有趣的人，在紧张的任务重总冷不丁闹出两句玩笑话，但在特工遇到瓶颈时总也能沉着冷静地给特工下达指令，而特工也总是能够以巧妙的手法达成指示解决问题。长时间的合作令他们之间保持着天衣无缝的默契。
时间回到这一天。这次，展现在特工面前的是一个将会杀死成千上万人的巨大威胁，计时器上的数字无限接近于0。
“特工，你不能这样做，这太危险了。特工？特工！”
唯独这次，特工没有遵守通讯员的指令。已经没有时间犹豫了，他将那个决定了他命运的按钮按了下去。

这不仅是一款好游戏，更是一部精美的好电影。
 
Ahlys

osap131
259 produits enregistrés

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2021
There's not too much to say for IEYTD 2, if you played the first game and liked it you'll adore this one, and if you didn't like the first game you'll hate it. If you haven't played the first game then go play that first. That said, as more of the first game with a more cohesive storyline you'll adore it.
 
The Nocturnal Lemon
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 septembre 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

My first experience in VR was the original I Expect You To Die which made me a believer and had me hunting for a VR headset everyday after I tried it.

I Expect You To Die 2 stays true to it's core and is just as good as the original. Right off the bat the intro already gives the impression of a high quality VR game and it continues throughout the entire playthrough. The narrative of the game does a great job of keeping the game immersion while being an entirely seated experience. It's both comfortable, yet engaging. The only downside of the game is that I wish it were longer, but mostly because I didn't want it to end. The replayability is somewhat limited to going back for missed souvenirs. Although I mostly played the original before they added more levels I hope they add additional levels and content to this one as well.

If you are a fan of the original you will enjoy the sequel as it is more of the same.
 
Emphasyze
1,084 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2021
This game is a VR delight just like the first one. The puzzles and gameplay are a lot of fun. It really nails the 60s-ish spy vibe with visuals and music. I'd say this one is even more thrilling towards the end in terms of story. Overall a fantastic follow up. If you liked the first one, definitely play this. If you haven't played the first one and like puzzle games, go play it then play this. Only thing I think could be improved is I wish more of the achievements showed up on Steam instead of just in game as "souvenirs." I enjoy looking through those on my Steam account from time to time and I like the little Steam popups as I play often saying something funny.

Delta
204 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2021
★★★★★★★★☆☆ (8/10)
= Ce qu'il faut savoir : j'ai joué et j'ai adoré le premier "I Expect You To Die" (fait à 100% avec tous les trophés)
Mon temps de jeu : 2h30 pour les 3 premières missions et le tutoriel en prenant mon temps
Fait sur Steam VR avec un Oculus Quest en Oculus Link

On incarne un agent secret qui doit faire appel à sa vivacité d'esprit (e.g. missile en approche) et sa capacité de déduction (puzzle en tout genre) pour se sortir de situations variées et mortelles.

Les +
+ Les puzzles sont compréhensibles, variés et amusant
+ Le 100% motivant à faire et pas artificiel
+ L'humour et l'ambiance générale du jeu
+ Tout le jeu se fait assis/en stationnaire ce qui est confortable et permet aux gens avec de petits espaces de s'amuser en VR.
+ La recalibration rapide en jeu
+ On peut maintenant figer un objet dans les airs pour toujours l'avoir à portée sans devoir le poser sur une table

Les +/-
+/- Pas de changements majeurs sur la formule depuis le précédent épisode je trouve (mais je l'ai fait en 2019 donc ça ne me gêne pas et les situations sont différentes de part le scénario)
+/- La télékinésie fonctionne toujours aussi bien mais les contrôles ne sont parfois pas aussi précis que souhaité

Les -
- Seulement en Anglais oral ET écrit ce qui peut être compliqué pour certaines énigmes basées sur les propos de PNJ (et pas de sous titre par défaut en tous cas)

Fais sur ma chaîne Twitch[twitch.tv]
Le tuto : Youtube | Twitch[www.twitch.tv]
La mission 1 : Youtube | Twitch[www.twitch.tv]
La mission 2 : Youtube | Twitch[www.twitch.tv]

Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 janvier 2022
An amazing sequel to one of my favourite VR games of all time. I Expect You To Die 2 improves upon the already brilliant formulae of the original with a new polish in the form of better graphics, a full story on release as well as new and exciting puzzles and mechanics for the play to solve.

Positives:

-Very fun
-Mechanics feel smooth
-Puzzles are relatively simple but make you feel like a genius when solving them

As for negatives the only thing I don't like about it is that there won't be any episodes added to it like the first game, making it longer on release than the original game but less episodes overall. Hopefully IEYTD gets frequent enough releases to keep us all entertained.

A unique style thats funny but also classy. the replay-ability is meh but going for the speedruns are very fun and challenges can add to it so you dont blow right through the game.

Xaser Saperto
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2023
How do I even start to explain how great this game is.

Just take everything the first game was and expand on that, that is pretty much it.
There are more levels, more characters, more amazing voices, interesting twists and so much more.
And the intro this time, jeez. It is the best one so far, it is so catchy that I listen to it at least once a week and it gets stuck in my head more often than I will ever admit, it is that amazing.

The only thing that I preferred in the first game, is the 'hub', in this case, a tiny van.
I loved the office from the first game where you could play around with sticks of dynamite, guns and more in this big space. This time around you're just stuck in a tiny van with barely any place to move. This would be fine if you could like open the doors behind you or maybe just have some special area or something, but no. It makes sense for the story, but personally I still prefer the big office.

I cannot recommend this game enough and I am so excited for the third game, I hope they never stop making these! :D
 
Caspian Cyndeon

Shurik Holmes
296 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2021
I really liked this game (minus one giant annoyance which I hope they patch). Same with the first game, it's a chair-only VR, and the comedy is fairly good, and the spy theme is great to play. I hope they continue to make more of these. I know it takes a lot of effort to make a good puzzle game like this, and I'm sure it's annoying when people complain there's only so much content, but I hope the dev can ignore the haters and make more of this series.

As for that annoyance, there's one mission where the controller vibrates when you're in an elevator. Literally you spend half the mission with your controller rumble at full power for no reason, draining the battery for nothing (as in I had to plug in my controllers to finish, they were not low battery when I started). At first I thought my controllers were broken because it wouldn't stop... I just disabled the rumble for the game completely at that point.

3 hours to complete, but went back to complete achievements for fun.
 
fiveeyes
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2021
I'm a big IEYTD1 fan. So it's only natural I was going to like #2. The environments are more complicated and missions are much longer with so many more options to learn and master. I have seen people say they completed this in 2 - 3 hours, but my first full playthrough was much longer. It was about 5 - 6 hours. I did struggle on a few of the levels and persisted until eventually found the solutions. I found the game enjoyable and rewarding. I liked how the story linked the missions, which was much better than #1. As with the first game, the replay value is in collecting the achievements and speedrunning. Which is super competitive. So once you have completed the game, there is plenty of reasons to play it again. It's a polished game and definitely worth the asking price.

I played the first game ages ago and it was great. I eagerly await the third game.

TheMcRaezy <3
581 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2021
Its ironic that a mediocre actor with delusions on grandeur voice acts a mediocre actor with delusions on grandeur.

If you have played the first game in the series, then this game is a continuation of the awesomeness of that title. its easily my favourite VR title and this one offers more of that same game play style that really works so well on the VR headset. If you haven't played the first, while I dont think its necessary to have done so, the game would make a lot more sense if you had.

Like the first, the puzzles weren't too hard to figure out, but i still felt a sense of satisfaction in solving them and I am looking forward to replaying them to try and get all of the achievements, including the speed run times. The clues are all there, but sometimes you need to look around a bit to find them.

There were a couple of moments where i felt the controls were a little clunky but for the most part it felt well designed.

My only real complaint about the game is in the choice of lead voice actor. I find the man unjustifiably smug at the best of times and he is no better in this as he just plays himself and at no point did i really feel like he was this world dominating super villain. which is sad because it could have made the game that oh so much better. That said, his talent is easily forgettable so it really was only a minor detraction from what is otherwise quite the fun puzzle game.

TLDR: Game is fun, puzzles are challenging but not insurmountable. I got about 3 hours on first play through. hoping to get another 3 hours getting all the achievements.
 
[MoX]Arken

Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2021
I recommend this if you like the first game or if you're ok with dying and doing the same thing over and over. It's a stationary escape the room game with 6 missions. It's very polished with good music and voice acting. Some of the controls need work though. It can sometimes be annoying trying to manipulate small objects. There are multiple souvenirs and hidden objects to find. It took me about 6 hours to finish. My gameplay video is below.
Vidéo YouTube™: I Expect You To Die 2 VR Gameplay w/ Valve Index (I Die A Lot)

Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2023
Don't worry guys, there's even more dying in this one! It's very clear to me that the devs still had tons of ideas they wanted to explore after the first game as every chapter in this sequel is super unique and they all twist in fun directions. The feel of a spy movie is even stronger here and the music is incredible. The mechanical side of how objects look, feel, and are interacted with has thankfully improved dramatically. Other than that what can I say? It's more VR puzzle game goodness.

A great sequel to a great game. Love the story, the voice acting, the original music and most importantly the game play itself. Only complaint I would have is the same I have for any great puzzle game - I wish it was longer. Don't get me wrong - this isn't one of those VR puzzle games you will solve in 10 mins, I just really enjoy the game, the immersive atmosphere, etc. and want more of it! Highly recommend. Hopefully IEYTD3 isn't too far away :)

6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2021
Dont get me wrong, i enjoyed this game but compared to the first one it didnt feel like a lot of effort had been put into the scenarios and puzzles. Think about the submarine and the space station in the first game. Nothing like that, just really simple basic puzzles. Add to that the guy speaking in your ear gives you waaay to much help. Too dumbed down imo and the puzzles are so easy that you're doing well to stretch this out to 3 or 4 hours of play. Buy if you're a fan but avoid if you;re expecting something on the same level as the first one.

IlyaVos
188 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 octobre 2021
This game just doesn't compare to the first one. The puzzles are easier, the traps are less deadly, even the deaths feel less realistic (they removed coughing audio when you die to gas). There was way too much exposition in the puzzles, which made speedruns boring. All of this is forgivable, but my main gripe with this game is that I never once felt like an actual spy. I felt like a guy doing vaguely related escape rooms. You can't smoke cigars until the last level, and you don't get a gun ever. Compared to the first game, this is a massive step down. Even based off the first level of both, the first game is still harder and much more interesting. To beat the first level in IEYTD1 you must: find the car key, start the car, dodge the laser, defuse the bomb, roll down the window, grab the screwdriver, roll the window back up so you don't die to poison gas, open the front panel, activate the cannon, load and fire said cannon, then drive the car off the back of a plane. To beat the first level in IEYTD2 you must: find the key , then unlock and raise the curtain , then unlock the wall safe on your left , then grab the gas can , switch it for the cooling can in the mask , and then "take care of" 4 people. Only at two points in this process are you in any actual danger, and even then it happens so slowly you have ample time to avoid it. Worst part is you can deal with those 4 guys nonviolently with the exception of one, who you must shoot (with a crossbow, since you don't get a gun). Why was the ability to go fully nonviolent removed from this game? Why was the ability to go fully violent removed as well? Let me do both, devs.
 
lordg52
134 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2021
This game is much easier and shorter than the first game. I felt that the puzzles were much less inventive and intricate. I am disappointed in the game for how much money that I spent on it, especially compared to the first one.
It's still a good game, but I would just get it at a heavy discount, as there isn't much in it.

174 produits enregistrés

0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Find my full review at
Vidéo YouTube™:  
Vues : 0


Pros
Fantastically designed puzzles
So many little details in the presentation
Lots of hidden items to find
Wil Wheaton’s performance as John Juniper

♥♥♥♥
A few more levels would be nice
Trial and Error might be off putting to some
Feels more like an expansion

I Expect You To Die 2 picks straight up where the original left off, bringing with it fantastically designed puzzles, that take a step up from the first game. Add to these all the nice little details they have put into the overall presentation of the game with the outstanding voice work, and it really does feel like the team have made improvements in every area. However, the game might feel short and more like an expansion to some, so a few more chapters would not have gone a miss. Even taking this into account, if you want an excellent and well polished escape room game in VR, adding I Expect You To Die 2 to your collection is not something you will regret.

Videonutt
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2022
First off, the game is not bad. The music is fun, generic spy story, fitting setting etc. However, it seemed to me like most of the work went into the first half and the last 2 levels were kind of lacking.

It's the kind of game where you can try a number of different things but the actual playthrough is straightforward. On one hand that is great, because you can quickly get back to the place where you died. Counterintuitive thing is that wanting to progress in the game makes you play really safe so you don't have to start over and over.

I had fun playing and as far as VR games go it was all right. the game hits the wall of what's possible with a sitdown VR experience. I got all the fun out of it in the one playthrough and I don't think I will replay the game in future.

Emrys
214 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2022
8/10

It's a good game and a worthy addition to the series, but I've got a few petty gripes for its execution.

Too many of the combination-lock-style puzzles are easy to brute-force. The locker code in the beginning of the game, the wine cellar towards the middle, The radio during the train section for the last game, the breakers during the plane section of this game. These puzzles all have one thing in common:

I solved all of them before I knew where to find the answer.

Granted, you can brute-force any puzzle in most games if you're determined enough, but codelocks in base three and binary lighting codes? That's baby's first brute-force.

Besides that, this whole game felt pretty anemic compared to the original, and I've got to wonder if it's because after a while you kind of 'get it' when it comes to IEYTD games. And puzzles that fail to innovate or improve upon the established formula are pretty easy to breeze past once all the pieces are in play.

I actually found one of the easter egg souveniers in the game because the easter egg was (to my mind) more obvious than the intended path. :/

I don't regret my purchase though. Great game all-around.
 
Matiorasu_TTV

Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2022
Expect you to Die 2 is a fun puzzle game, but it falls significantly short of the original. The levels go by faster with fewer puzzles in each level. The puzzles also seem less cheeky and witty. The first "Expect you to die" has puzzles where the solutions felt like clever jokes by the level designers. These puzzles seemed like a cheap escape room. (Find the code, put in the code). It's still not a bad game, but compared to the first one, it was disappointing. Overall 6/10

Ash.
413 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2023
While a decent VR game on its own, it's a downgrade in many aspects to the first.
After I completed this one, I went back to the first to make sure... and yes.. graphically it's worse.
Gameplay wise the puzzles twice even three times the length of the original cause they are filled with unskippable bloat.
I don't want to listen to a villain monologue for up to 30 seconds each time I have to restart. In almost every level there are manditory parts where you have to wait and listen to dialogue. This makes going for speedruns feel really bad.

It's also missing polish. Some interactions just didn't work, even though logically they should.
Interactions also feel much less personal, cause the levels are much bigger (relying on the telekenisis much more)

Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2022
Just like the original, a great game.
Escape-room lite.

Wish there were a few more levels but that's always going to be the case with games you enjoy. Replay-ability is minimum of course so don't ruin the experience by looking up walkthroughs obviously.

Its nice to play a non-sweaty sit down VR game once in a while.

Recommended.

800Fishys
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
24.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2021
I Expect You To Die 2 is the second game in a VR escape room, puzzle game with an action twist. In the game you play as spy who is on a mission to defeat the evil, Dr. Zor. The game is played seated, and contains 6 levels, a speedrun challenge, and secret achievements for each level.

The game has 6 extremely well designed levels, each with their own piece of the story, and different puzzels that can be very difficult to figure out. In each level you need help stop one of Zor's plans, without dying to the many traps. Each of the 6 levels this game offers include a unique setting, unique mechanics, and unique achievements. These achievements always include a speed run, and a bunch of secret ones which range from picking up hidden items, to beating the levels in a completely different way. The speedruns are very cool, as a level that takes 15 minutes the first couple times, could have a speedrun of 2 minutes. This is because some items have multiple uses, and some puzzles have multiple ways to complete them.

The games story is pretty good and has a very cool antagonist, John Juniper who is a theatre actor turned evil.
The game also includes a very cool and well done opening credits and an original song. It includes a lot of random stuff that you can mess around with during the levels, and sometimes some funny things too.

As for the game play hours, it all depends on how good you are at puzzle games, and how much time you're willing to put into achievements. I personally put a good amount of hours into this, but still had to look some up, as I had tried for an hour previously. You might want to wait for a sale, but I think the game is fairly priced as it is the best VR puzzle game on the market in my opinion. I would definitely recommend this game if it sounds appealing to you, I had a lot of fun playing it and can't wait for the next game.

Hopefully this helped! :)
 
Shadowcadet26

Recommandé
9.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 décembre 2022
This game and it's predecessor are everything you hope for when you pick up a VR headset. Fun, innovative, immersive. This is a must have for any VR gamer, regardless of your preferences and gaming history. It's a single player escape room, but such a high quality and humourous experience at that.
 
Jeebus (I died for your wins)
299 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2022
Pretty disappointing follow up to the excellent IEYTD1.

* There are a lot more "HA, GOTCHA!!" traps than the first game. Sure, infinite retries, but it's really immersion breaking sometimes. For example, somewhere in the game, a glass container rolls out of a chute, breaks on the ground, and shatters causing a fire. Catching it breaks it. You have no way to deal with that trap until later in that stage. It feels like a really cheap way to force a retry.

* The danger stakes have raised in some missions, but it's illusionary. Trying hard not to spoil, there's a part where there's "something coming" to blow you up but you have so much time to deal with its countermeasures that it doesn't really feel like a real threat.

* In that same stage, there's a kind of cloned version of "Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes." That's a fun game, but here the descriptions you get are so incredibly easy, and the actual manipulations you have to do never change. So, really, it turns into whether you can remember or not. It's more fun than trying to find random bits of paper with instructions on them, sure, but the implementation was so lazy on this.

* From the description: "Go undercover using disguises to figure out exactly what Zoraxis is up to." No, not really. You still don't really interact directly with people (which is fine), but whether you wear a hat or not doesn't really change up anything, it's really only there for jokes.

* Some puzzles have multiple ways to solve them, but it's usually "use this thing" or "use this other thing". Anything with a multi-stage solution is going to be the only way to solve things, period. With the extra experience of the team I was kind of hoping for something a little less spoon-fed.

* The voice casting for the villain is probably the worst casting I've ever heard for any kind of game. Such a whiny hipster voice for a character that should have been smooth and sophisticated, considering who he is and what he's up to. It's really out of place for the other voices which are mostly campy with some fake accents and are really fun. Juniper is not fun at all.

I really hope Schell Games does better next time.
 
Mazaw
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2022
Too short

Welmo
126 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2021
A VR room-escape-style puzzle game that truly understands the VR player. Wear everything as a hat. Set everything on fire (be careful, some things are explosive). As far as the actual gameplay is concerned:
  • Retains the previous entry's elegant answer to adventure game puzzles solved (sometimes at a distance) while stationary.
  • Not every problem has a singular solution.
  • Humor and writing remains excellent.
  • Levels are short and sweet, dying (as you are expected to) never puts you back far.
  • A good mix of sections where you have all the time in the world, and small bits where the pressure is on.
 
MrIncognito

Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2022
This is essentially an expansion to the first game - there are no new gameplay elements or graphical improvements and the levels are not as fun. The puzzles are also less intuitive and I even had to google for hints at one point.

Putting a thumbs down not because it's a bad game, but because you should buy the first game first and if you like that one and want more of the same, buy this game as well.

Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2023
the original IEYTD was one of the first things I ever played in VR, so when a sequel was announced I found myself very excited at the opportunity to return as agent phoenix and explore a new set of puzzles, and this didn't disappoint! it's very clear the team had a lot more ideas for how to use the medium to create a set of unique puzzles and interactions that expand on the original, and from those ideas they put together a wonderful collection of new levels that were a delight to experience. this series has become one of my favourites in the VR space and I'm excited for future entries

6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2023
dans la même veine que le 1.
missions bien foutues malgré le fait que le jeu soit court comme le 1 (entre 3 et 5h env)
attention pour les anglophobes : jeu exclusivement en anglais, aucun doublages ni sous titres (contrairement au 1 qui était sous titré) - ça peut être un frein pour certains et ça peut complexifier la compréhension des missions pour quelqu'un qui n'est pas à l'aise avec la langue de Shakespeare.
mention spéciale pour la petite video d'intro dans le style 007 que j'ai trouvé bien foutue.
en résumé : je recommande mais en promotion compte tenu de la faible durée de vie et du prix hors promo plutôt conséquent. (j'ai l'impression de me répéter à chaque eval de jeu VR 😂)

If you like escape room puzzles, this is for you. A series of 6 solo puzzles with interesting little VR mechanics. Total length is a bit short, but that's entirely ok since VR gaming for long hours can be disorienting.

Infinite
140 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2023
Продолжение игры про шпионов, в целом впечатление положительное: сидячий геймплей (это уже скорее фишка этой игры) отлично заходит когда стоять уже не можешь, английский не сложный, сюжет нормальный.

Но... Не могу не отметить ряд минусов относительно первой части:
- Нелогичность некоторых загадок (привет уровень в подвале)
- Куда меньшая длительность (хотя и первая была коротковата, эта часть еще короче)
- Ближе к концу загадки становятся проще (заканчивалась фантазия?)

На всякий случай для тех кто захочет купить: в игре отсутствуют субтитры (и это при жесткой необходимости делать то что говорят), если знание английского позволяет воспринимать речь на слух - можно играть, иначе будет скорее мучение от непонимания что от тебя хочет игра.

GOLDY
341 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2023
I didn't think the second game would be so much better than the first. The first game was a 9/10, but now that I've played this game, It's changed my whole perspective on VR puzzle games and puzzle games in general. The intro is better, the visuals are better, the story is better, the puzzles are more fun, the environments are more interesting, the puzzles are more consistent, and somehow it takes up even less space than the first game. The first game lacked an actual story for the most part, but this one has multiple named antagonists, and an actual face-to-face encounter with one of them. The only complaint I could possibly have, is that the puzzles were too easy. They didn't have quite the same difficulty or complexity as the first game, so you didn't feel as clever as you did in the first game. Can't wait for the third game!
 
Larson

Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2023
Очень короткая игра с либо простыми, либо нудными заданиями. Единственная хорошая миссия - самолет. Задачи решаются однообразно: надо найти нужный предмет и положить его в определенное место или то же самое, но на скорость. У игры такие позитивные отзывы из-за VR. Эта игра одна из первых игр, которую покупают с VR очками. У меня уже опыт в VR большой, поэтому у меня нет вау эффекта от этой игры. Как игра для первых ощущений VR она хороша, но как отдельная игра - нет
на этот отзыв открыты комментарии, так что меня можно переубедить

The only reason this isn't a 10/10 game, (My opinion) is because of the minor bugs and the short length of the game.

9.5/10

Évaluation publiée le 27 mai 2023
Honestly, it's too expensive for the amount of content you get. There is almost no replayability (except if you're speedrunning, etc) as you have already gone through everything: there is no puzzle. Maybe except for collecting the "movie trophies" (I forgot what they're called).

HOWEVER. It's a good game, which is an excellent sequel to the original game. It's excellent if you love a great challenge and definitely will get you frustrated at times when you keep dying, over and over again.

WifiCable
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mai 2023
If you liked the first I Expect You to Die, you will also like this one. I bought the bundle. The first time I loaded I Expect You to Die 2 I got a message saying that my headset was not supported. I have an HP G2 Reverb. When Steam wouldn't give me a refund, I tried launching the game from Steam and it worked with no issues.

I enjoyed both games, but I felt this one was better thanks to a cohesive story. Each mission plays off the previous mission, with the character Juniper appearing in each. Like the first title, there is no motion. All of your puzzle-solving is done from a sitting position.

I wouldn't say that the puzzles are easy, but they're also not so difficult that they are unsolvable. The whole idea behind this series is that each puzzle has about seven to eight steps. You're not going to figure out each step the first time through. Instead, like in the Tom Cruise movie, you learn from your mistakes and get better each time.

Since you are in a sitting position, the answer to every puzzle is in your field of vision. I solved every puzzle without resorting to going online, which leads me to another topic – hints. I have to say that I am conflicted on this issue. On the one hand, I think every game should have a progressive hint feature that doesn't give you the answer but leads you in the right direction. One game that has done this very well is the game The Room VR. This game, however, would not be a good candidate for progressive hints. Hints would take away from the satisfaction you get from solving the puzzles.

As for graphics and sound, both are well done but a little on the cartoonish side. One thing I noticed with this version was that there seemed to be a lot of red herrings. More than a couple of times I ended up spending too much time on items that didn't help me in solving a puzzle.

The one puzzle that took me the longest was the wine cellar puzzle. It took me three tries to get this one. I will say that once I figured it out, I raised my arms in a victory celebration, which probably looked ridiculous.

This version seemed to have one or two fewer puzzles to solve than the first one, which is not a bad thing. I know when I solved the last puzzle I was surprised to see the end credits.
 
emilio
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2023
I don't know how they do it but these guys have managed to perfectly encapsulate old school silly spy shenanigans and packed it into the perfect VR game package. I cannot recommended it highly enough both for those new and old to VR as no matter who you are, you are bound to have an absolute blast playing it.

The intro credits and song is always one of the most memorable parts of the game, and while I think nothing can beat the original song/lyrics, this new one still has all of the same flavour, theme and feel to it, just like when you would watch a new old school bond film you knew right off the bat you were going to love every second of what was to come.

KitCatt
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2023
I wish I could give this both a thumbs up and a thumbs down. Not a neutral review, actually both positive and negative.

The first half of the game is really charming and enjoyable. The puzzles make sense, and while challenging can still be reasonably figured out with a few tries.

The second half of the game is the exact polar opposite. The puzzles are so convoluted and the solutions are so arbitrary, with no actual logic that it reminds me of the suffering caused by 1980s Searra games

NEVER GIVE UP
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 janvier 2023
+Fun!
+Well Written
+Lots to interact with
+Lots of Secrets

+/- Seated Experience
+/- Wil Wheaton Voices a character

-short/ish for price

4/5

Fantastic sequel. They really didn't pull any punches in releasing this. Aside from the game length compared to the price of the game. However there's plenty of repeatability to get all the collectibles and would definitely be a fun game to let friends/people not used to VR games play. I'd definitely recommend it, possibly on sale though.

If you liked this review Make sure to Click here and give a follow for more reviews of good, bad and decent VR titles. And Click here if you want to request reviews on other VR titles.

polished vr experience...puzzles are hard and weren't handed to you. would recommend a fast forward feature because it became frustrating at times to redo 90% of a level just to get 10 seconds of time to try and progress until you die. did not say this in my IEYTD 1 review but same situation. recommend buying
 
tradergodx
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2023
Great game, and a great sequel for I Expect you to Die 1.

Just like the first game, this plays like several escape games. You have a mission that usually requires you to be in one room, and you have to do your best to survive and complete the mission, all with a spy theme of course.

It's not super serious, it's rather light hearted and fun. If you haven't played the first one, I recommend you play that one first, and come back to play the second one afterwards. Those two games go great together!

Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2022
Played this on a Quest 2 over AirLink. Gaming PC has a Ryzen 5 3600, 16 GB RAM, and a 1080 Ti

This game was great - it ran great, the puzzles were great, and everything else was amazing. The controls in this were much better than the first (however, I played them back to back... so I kept getting things mixed up) and the puzzles had the ideal difficulty.

Get this game.
 
[LUE] bros
546 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2022
В первую часть играл давно, может что то забыл или перепутал.
После первой части кажется короче, очень жаль. Хотя время проведенное там и тут примерно одинаковое. Наверно, миссия с подводной лодкой из первой части оказалась для многих трудной, больше подобных миссий нет, чуть ли не до посинения можешь сидеть над одной загадкой, не назвал бы это плюсом или минусом, просто чуть динамика потерялась. В целом мне понравилось и хотелось бы ещё. Развитие сюжета в этой части показалось интересней. Английский остался примерно на том же уровне, ничего особо сложного нет.

SERIOUS
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2022
The currently two I Expect You To Die games are two masterpieces. To start, the game in my opinion is worth it. While there may not seem like there aren't many missions, they are created very well. Each level also has hidden secrets in it, which take time to find, as well as speedrunning achievements for each mission. The story is great, and you really feel like a spy stopping an evil villain's plans. Both games start with an amazing intro song, and intro cinematic that's put together very well. When playing it was completely polished, no bugs to be found at all. Overall, I have had a ton of fun playing the games and I'm excited to see what Schell Games will bring us in the next game in the series.

10/10

Highly recommended

SergyP
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 octobre 2022
I adore this game! Along with it's predecessor, it's a perfect little VR escape room that you can play in your own home. The puzzles are inventive and fun, and the story/tone of the game is charming and a delight to explore. I also love that they have extra challenges once you've beaten the missions (like getting all the in-game achievements, and doing the speedruns) that add an extra layer of challenge.

Do you like puzzle games? Do you like escape rooms? Do you like having a blast in VR? Get this game!

I love this dev and I can't wait to see what they do next!
 
Kukov
460 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 octobre 2022
My review for this will be very similar to IEYTD 1, as most of the gameplay elements carry over to this one.

As with the first game, this is a very creative way to handle Escape Room type VR games. Rather than just throwing you into a puzzle to solve, you actually become part of the story line and your goal isn't always to escape.

The developers keep putting a lot of love into this game and it shows, all the tiny details and carefully thought out interactions with the world and its objects. The music, the voice acting, and the classy intros. They get the settings correct and it keeps things immersive even though it's a sit-down VR game. The first game, after completing it, allowed the player to go through developer commentary for each level. However it appears to be absent in this game, unless I've missed it?

Controller sensitivity appears to have been fixed in this game, I no longer had issues releasing objects or pressing the wrong buttons. Other than that it was bug free for my playthrough. Also, Wil Wheaton.
 
Captin
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2022
I enjoyed the first game, and have been enjoying this game as well now!

There is one major issue however, and that controllers with thumbstcks will have major issues with the telekinesis system ingame. I had this issue at one point and so left a negative review, but the devs had responded with the fix, adding the launch option -vrhands oculus, to switch to the oculus hands which the game does have bindings for. This made the game playable.

Overall, the game is very fun and a true sequel to the original: keeping the good elements from the original and innovating and expanding on what made the game fun. Level design is very clever, although puzzles can be slightly unclear on occasion. The game now has a proper villain, who is very fun and brings something new to the game. The devs also seem very communicative, so don't hesitate to speak up if you need help!

One critisism to make though is that the game is short if you are not going for all achivements and collectables in the game.

Overall, the game is definitely one of the best games for vr right now, but slightly pricey for the game legth. If you see this on sale though, definitely pick it up!
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2022
If you're expecting a long game out of this or the first game for that matter, you're probably not going to find it. However I Expect You to Die 2 manages to step up its predecessor in a lot of ways including giving you a foil in the form of John Juniper which makes it more entertaining to manage to get a leg up on him and Zoraxis. If you don't mind the price tag, I can definitely recommend this to fans of the first game and fans of escape room games in general.
 
SusanosWrath
1,094 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 septembre 2022
++ Unlike a lot of VR games out there, IEYTD 2 is polished beyond a merely functional experience to the point of artistry. It's not especially complex, but it has a clear and immersive identity that balances aesthetic and function. Schell Games continues to be one of the good ones out there.
++ Capital 'Gee' Good voice acting
+ It's nice to have a role for Will Wheaton where he doesn't actually have to do any acting and he can just cut loose and be his true self.
+ I'd call it family friendly
+ Runs well with even lower end VR GPUs (RX480 to RX 6600)
+ Works with even the Oculus Rift CV1 no problem.
+ A fair enough deal even at full price ($24.99 USD at the moment).
+ Has some replay-ability with hidden objects and speed runs
+ An experience worth sharing.

~/- Not an especially long experience, but that is somewhat reflected in the price point.

- I swear they used to have a free demo, but they don't seem to now. I feel having demos should be the industry standard for VR titles whenever possible.

= One of the best experiences in VR right now, and the standard a lot of other VR games should aspire to. But it's like a pleasant slice of what I'd imagine a "full length" AAA VR game would look like; if you were polite you'd say you were satisfied, but really a little bit more would be nice. To that end I think the first game offers a better value proposition in some ways at this time, and I might recommend you start there, especially if you can catch a sale. But if you liked the first game, this one is a no brainer.

Recommandé
23.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2022
This game is a masterclass on how to put together a great VR title. It's funny, engaging, detailed, immersive, and incredibly intuitive in a way most VR games aren't. It's also an incredible step up from the first, which is very impressive considering the quality and replayability of it. Overall, this game is criminally underrated and a definite must-buy for anyone with a VR headset.
 
Cookieguy2016
33 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2022
(Warning VERY minor spoilers for two levels of the game) This is one of my favorite VR games I have played. The game is incredibly witty and charming. I was afraid i wasn't going to like it a much as the first game but It was even better than the first. (And the first one was amazing.) The puzzles were the right amount of challenge. They didn't feel impossible but also didn't feel brain dead easy. the game requires outside of the box thinking mixed with escape room like puzzles. Unfortunately there is not a whole lot of replay value in the game. sure there is achievement but I didn't really care about those all to much. I loved levels like the first one where you got to play a the stage hand for a show. That one was a little less linear and had some replay value to it because you could do many different things in the level. same with the level in the wine cellar. I wish more levels had this replay value. The game could also get annoying when you would get to the end of the level, then not know what to do, die, and then have to restart, and then do everything you just did all over again. I get is the name of the game but I wish there was an option to start a little before you died so you don't have to replay parts you just did. The levels aren't to long so its not a horrible problem. Those are just a few complaints I have and honestly none of them got in the way of my enjoyment of the game. I love creating my own spy character in my head and I very much enjoyed having the Handler character chiming in. Solid game and I highly recommend especially if you like puzzles or escape rooms. But i think this game can also be appealing even if you don't.

Bang Bang Bart
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2022
전작에 비해 진화한 듯 퇴보했다. 확실히 스토리텔링이나 스케일 확장에는 공을 들인 티가 나는데, 게임 디자인, 가이드, 그리고 창발적 플레이의 측면에서 아쉬운 점이 보인다.

게임 디자인
2번째 레벨에서 기내식 트롤리를 호출하는 버튼을 한 번 더 누르면 호출된 트롤리를 치울 수 있다는 사실을 깨닫기가 어렵다는 점을 예시로 들 수 있다. 버튼 대신에 위/아래로 ON/OFF하는 스위치 같은 걸 두었다면 좋았을 것이다. 전작의 2번째 레벨에서 원소 주기율표를 살짝 비뚤게 배치해서 플레이어가 해당 오브젝트를 쉽게 알아차릴 수 있게 장치를 해 두는 디테일을 자랑했던 제작진이만큼 더욱 이러한 점이 아쉬웠다.

가이드
여기서 가이드라고 한다면 핸들러 등의 내레이션을 가리키는 것으로 한정하고 싶다. 전작에 비해 플레이어가 내레이션에 의지해야 하는 부분이 대폭 늘어났는데, 그럼에도 자막 기능을 지원하지 않는다는 점이 잘 이해되지 않았다. 또한 다시 2번째 레벨을 예로 들자면 핸들러가 목적지를 리스본으로 변경하라는 결정적인 지시를 딱 한 번만 들려주기 때문에 자칫 놓치면 게임 진행이 안 되는 부분도 가이드 부족의 예시로 말할 수 있겠다.

창발적 플레이
전작에서는 1번째 레벨에서 샴페인 병을 깨뜨린 뒤 그 깨진 병으로 칼을 대신해 시한폭탄의 전선을 자를 수 있는 등의 창의적인 플레이가 가능했는데, 이번 작품에서는 그런 요소들이 많이 줄어들었다. 물론 게임 제목을 따라 죽을 수 있는 방법이 늘어난 느낌은 들지만, 이 부분은 게임 진행보다는 스피드런을 하다가 동선이 꼬였을 때 빠른 재시작을 위한 유용한 도구로밖에는 보이지 않는다.

결론적으로 VR 시장 태동기에 나오다시피 한 1편보다 게임적으로 아쉬움이 많이 남는 작품이다. 다만 전작보다 레벨 간 연결성이 더 강화된 흥미진진한 스토리 구성은 마음에 들었다.
 
청산가리라떼

friusptsch
401 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2022
A phenomenal sequel to a phenomenal puzzle game. If you liked the first you'll love the 2nd. I find the environments very immersive and pretty interactive, and you get to feel like a badass spy the whole time. The puzzles are just as creative and I find the narrative even more creative just around. This and IEYTD1 are must play VR games imo, and if you have any interest at all in puzzle or escape room style games you love it. Only issue with this game is it is a bit on the shorter side. Looking forward to more content though!

MiniNinja315
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2022
Having only played the first game knowing the solutions beforehand (Thanks, YouTube), I was over the moon when they announced a sequel. Let's just say it was worth the wait. Going in blind was a completely different experience, having to figure out the puzzles through trial and error. I will say that this game is much more forgiving than its predecessor, but it was still challenging. The intro music slaps as per usual of Schell, the voices are amazingly done (Especially the antagonist), and the little side missions to get collectables were still fun to figure out. I definitely think this was the better of the two, but you should still play the first to get a handle on the story before moving to this one.

r43r
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2022
I Expect You To Die 2 follows pretty well the same formula as the first game, with a few changes or improvements depending on your own preferences.

The game's scope is a little grander, with better-looking graphics, and overall better production value. The levels feel less like escape rooms and more like real environments, there's a more cohesive story present, and more voice acting to compliment it.

I found the puzzles took a little more brain power to work out, which made my first playthrough last a little longer than in the first game, but with the new larger levels and more complex puzzles took away my drive to go for 100% completion.

Overall, the game takes itself about 5% more seriously, with a little lean away from comedy and towards drama, while still keeping the same tongue in cheek attitude towards classic spy tropes.

Maximum Destroyer
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mars 2022
An improvement on the first game in a few ways. Same core premise, but new puzzles, more interaction, and just more of the fun.

I was able to 100% it (collectibles, easter eggs, and speedruns) in under 6 hours. If you're just looking for story, you should be able to do it in half that.

A well polished VR game that is not always easy to find these days.

KayKasuke
149 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 février 2022
Solid game. I would recommend the first one over this sequel to anyone who hasn't played it yet; this is basically another six levels of that same game, and it follows the story set up from the original. They did nothing to change the formula; which is fine, it still works, and both games are quite short. If you wanted more of the first game, as I did, this is exactly that.

To anyone not familiar with the first one, this is basically a collection of VR escape rooms. They are well-designed and most problems have several potential solutions, all of which are reasonably intuitive. You are likely to get stuck a few times but not for more than a few minutes if you're persistent.

The game is unlikely to make you motion sick and is appropriate for everyone from hardcore gamers to casual players to children.
 
theothersteve7
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 janvier 2022
Like part one, their unique "telekinesis" game mechanic is superb. I thought other devs would take heed and implement similar ideas into their games but that hasn't happened. Only HL:Alyx's gravity gloves. People in VR don't want to bend over and fiddle with odd drawer physics and awkward item pickups clipping through your actual floor where you can't pick them up.

That said the game is a continuation of part one. An utter delight to play and be in this world. Although I haven't completed it yet, I suspect a game that is shorter than expected too as all VR titles are with exceptions. Still love it. These VR devs who have been there since the beginning get it.

I hope this is released on PS5VR and makes big bucks, this studio deserves it. Hey folks their other game Until You Fall is great too, check it out.

BenchWig The Tank
183 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2022
A fun creative escape room game. Mostly keeping the same formula from the original. Highly recommend for escape room/puzzle game fans and fans of the original.

As in the name of the game you will eventually die, causing you to restart that level from the beginning. Which actually isn’t much of a hinderance because it never takes more than a few minutes (if that) to solve the puzzles again to get yourself back in the same situation just before you had died previously.

Once you solve a level the mystery is over so there isn’t much of a reason to replay a level other than for a speed run, but that is the nature of this type of game and not a reason to not grab this game if you are into escape rooms.

The only negative I will give to this game is that PC users don’t have any graphical options to increase resolution (I couldn’t find it if there is one). The game does not look bad by any means but I couldn’t help shake the feeling that the graphics are being held back a bit so the game can run on less powerful hardware.

When I finally completed all the levels I was left wanting more levels to play. Definitely looking forward to any dlc and another sequel.
 
Lazy CJ
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2022
Absolutely phenomenal game that IMO is well worth the full price. If you haven't played the first it's an puzzle/escape room type game that's half James Bond, half Austin Powers. I'd suggest playing the first game before this, but it's not strictly necessary.

Pros:
- I didn't think it's possible, but the intro cutscene for this game is even better than the first
- Great level variety
- Great voice acting
- Great music & graphics
- I loved some of the more random things you can do just for fun. Lots of stuff to play with and mischief to get up to.
- Plenty of "souvenirs" to find
- The speedrun times are challenging without being frustrating

♥♥♥♥:
Honestly I can't really think of any. I didn't want it to end, but it did anyway.

Verdict: 10/10

Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
More of the same type of sequel. But it's fine since I Expect You To Die is one of the best VR puzzles/escape rooms.

All the strength of the original are here too: good pacing, interesting and varied puzzles with possible alternative solutions, good sense of humor and one of the best opening credits out there. Plus now we have a story and characters to give more context to the puzzles and environments.

Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2022
Just recently 100% this game and i have to say, it's a must pick up for anyone with a vr headset.
The combination of style, charm and amazing level design makes for such an amazing experience.

The only gripe I have with this great game is that its only 6/7 hours long, 2 or 3 if you don't grab bits and bobs around the place which in most cases make a game hard to recommend but the masterclass attention to detail this game has from start to finish makes the game worth full price.

Highly recommend this lovely game, hoping for another game :)

"I expect you to die 2" ist ein gelungener Nachfolger zum ersten Teil der Reihe. Die Rätsel sind nicht zu anspruchsvoll, auch wenn an der ein oder anderen Stelle ich zu doof war es zu lösen. Gerade das hineinwerfen ins Unerwartete und die Falle, die hinter jeder Ecke lauern kann, machen die Spannung nur noch größer. Nur bei den Waffen haben sie in diesem Teil von Pistole auf Geringeres heruntergeschraubt, ein gewisser britischer Agent wäre enttäuscht. Alles in allem:

9 / 10 Punkten

Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2022
1도 재밌었는데 2도 압도적 긍정적 평가값을 한다!
다만 게임이 1에 비해 비교적 짧게 느껴지고, 한글화가 아예 안되어있는데다가 자막도 없는 상황인데도 4시간 남짓 걸린 것을 보면 그런 것 같다

퍼즐의 난이도는 확실히 1쪽이 좀 더 어렵다는 느낌
한글화에 자막까지 나와서 설명해주는 마당에도 좀 어려웠으니
2는 자막도 없고 영어도 알아듣기 않은데 생각보다 집중해보면 나름 할만하다

전체적으로 볼 때 볼륨은 조금 아쉽지만, 1보다 발전한 퍼포먼스와 그래픽
1에서는 아무리 목소리가 들려도 고독하다는 느낌을 지울 수 없었는데
2에서는 다른 NPC의 움직임이나 목소리도 자주 들리고 대화도 자주 오가는 것이 내가 진짜 이 무대에 헤쳐나가는 주인공이란 느낌이 들었다

지나치게 1과 비교하기는 했지만, 정말 재밌게 했다
갖가지 긴박한 연출도 그렇고 1은 퍼즐을 푸는것에 역할이 부가적인 것이라면
2는 정말 내가 비밀요원이 되어서 특급임무를 맡고있는 듯한 기분이 들게 해준다

VR이 있다면 정말 추천하는 게임 중 하나다. 1도 해보고 2도 해보는 것을 추천한다

+개인적인 문제다만 오큘러스 리프트에서 바로 실행하려고하면 실행이 안되는 오류가 있다
이때는 SteamVR로 실행하면 정상 실행된다
 
Black-Eye
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé

Amazing game, I don't regret the purchase. The into is amazing.

Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2022
I Expect You To Die 2 has an refined story and a stronger cast of characters. Most of the puzzles feel more logical if harder than the first IEYTD. The only criticism I have is that the first game had more variety of exotic locations; but I am more invested in the story now and I am excited to see what I Expect You To Die 3 brings to the table.
 
Unit13
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
23.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2022
Straight to this one as I hadn't played the first but very enjoyable. At first it's frustrating when you're sent back to the start of the level when you die, but you quickly realise it's pretty quick to get back to the same point to try again. Good voice acting, good puzzles and good VR controls. My only complaint is the length of the game which is quite short - this'd be OK if it was a game you'd go back to again and again but this isn't this type of game. Definitely worth it if it's on sale.

Very fun. The puzzles are challenging, but not too far to where they're obtuse. The storyline is interesting, with a fun twist partway through. The replay value is incredible. The base game is pretty short; Just a standard "get through the levels in ~30 minutes each", but the challenges and collectibles provided are enough to keep you going for hours upon hours.

It's all over much too quickly, I got about 5 hours out of it.

Hunderon
300 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2021
10/10

This game might as well be just an expansion pack of the first game.
No new mechanics, no new gimmicks, just you, your skills, and your hat .

If you enjoyed the first game, you will enjoy this game without a doubt.
I just wish it were longer, but I am very satisfied.

All of the puzzles are solvable, or at least make sense. No hidden tricks required. That does not mean the developers did not think about it. ;)

Don't spoil yourself, this is a game best explored blind!

TNTino
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2021
It can be hard to tell whether a VR game is worth it, given that there are many where the main selling point is that the experience is in VR. I Expect You To Die is not one of those titles.

Both the first and second entries are fully fleshed out games that host wonderfully executed puzzle/escape room games. The puzzles are challenging but not to a point where they are frustrating. The spy theme works really well in both titles but the story flows more organically in the second entry.

The games offers lots of interactive items to play around with immerse you as a super spy, all which make it a robust experience.

Both games have a limited amount of levels with 6 in each one. However, each level is unique and offers lots of Easter Eggs which increase the replay value.

If you own a VR set and are looking for a new and fleshed out experience, I recommend getting it, even at full price. I'll be looking forward to what more Schell Games has to offer with I Expect You To Die.

I see... If you survive this one agent, I shall be in touch.
 
ElrichV
547 produits enregistrés

0

3.8 h en tout

AlphaBimbleton
285 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2021
Хорошее и качественно продолжение первой части. Вновь мы должны сидя на одном месте решать головоломки и выполнять различные шпионские задание. Загадки иногда бывают странными, но довольно изобретательными. Также имеется и неплохой юмор как визуальный, так и текстовый в различных диалогах. Но всё только на английском, так что знание языка необходимо. Без него даже понять что делать не получится.

Единственным минусом я бы назвал продолжительность. Игра проходится за 2,5 часа. Можно потратить больше времени на выполнение доп. заданий и прохождение миссий на время, но это уже на любителя.
 
Volviq

전작을 재미있게 즐겼거나 퍼즐게임을 좋아한다 싶으면 구매하시면 되겠습니다. 물론 전작과 스토리가 이어지므로 전작을 안해보셨다면 전작부터 해보시는 걸 추천합니다.(마침 얼마전에 한글화가 됐더라고요.)

Quelques amélioration par rapport au premier, aussi bien niveau graphique que niveau gameplay.

Je conseil fortement de l'acheté à prix réduit (15€ aurait été probablement plus logique vu la longueur du jeu, mais je me doute que de rendre un jeu agréable en VR demande ajd'hui plus de temps et donc plus d'argent).

fonctionne très bien sur un casque windows mixed reality (HP VR1000)
 
Amau
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2021
My VR Game Of The Year

Where to begin with this masterpiece? IEYTD2 is a true sequel to its original, and much like it, is insanely fun. I only wish there were more levels - much like the predecessor, it leaves you wanting more after.

The puzzles are expertly crafted and there is more than one way to do most things. And even after you've beaten the game, I recommend going back and attempting to get every single achievement - beating all speedruns and collecting all trophies. I was only able to put this game down after I was sure I had done everything.

Pros:
- Literally everything

♥♥♥♥:
- Kind of short, despite its replay value

Bonus points for including Lisbon! Also - the opening theme is a banger
