4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2021
Na mesma pegada de seu antecessor, I Expect You To DIe 2 irá te entreter enquanto te imerge em um mundo de conspirações e agentes secretos. Utilizando de gadgets, luvas gravitacionais, e todo o ambiente em volta, tente completar "missões impossíveis" para um agente comum.

Recomendado para aqueles que ainda não possuem muitos jogos de VR.
 
XGarbas
3,569 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2021
Excellent, dans la lignée du premier, toujours aussi plaisant. Pour ceux qui connaissent le premier, aucune surprise à attendre, mais aucune déception non plus. Pour ceux qui ne connaîtraient pas, courrez les acheter tous les deux et les enchaîner.

Après 4 ans de VR et 2 casques successifs, ce jeu a priori sans grande prétention est l'un de mes 3 ou 4 préférés. Certes il est court, certes les graphismes sont relativement simples, mais ce qu'il fait, à savoir une succession de mini escape games extrêmement drôles, bien écris et bien pensés, il le fait parfaitement.

A noter tout de même qu'un bon niveau d'Anglais est conseillé. Les protagonistes parlent très clairement dans un anglais très chatié, mais il vous faudra comprendre parfaitement tout ce qu'ils disent, souvent sous pression. Je ne sais pas si le jeu propose des sous-titres, mais c'est un des problèmes de la VR, les sous-titres c'est atroce.

Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2021
This game is awesome. "I Expect You To Die 2" is another great game in the "I Expect You To Die" franchise. This game is basically like the first one, in both quality and puzzle difficulty. I personally think that the sequel is a more difficult game, but that depends on personal opinion.
The "I Expect You To Die" games are the perfect and simple Vr games (simple as in: Not any motion sickness, considering you are sitting the same spot all time), but even though it's simple, it's very high quality.
This game definately deserves a perfect score of 10/10.

Gym Leader Heather
766 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 octobre 2021
I enjoyed this game, just like I enjoyed the first, that is overall I enjoyed it

Like many Vr games, this suffers from not enough content. Outside of the initial solution where everything is new, and deaths happen frequently, for me at least, the levels start to feel small, which may be purposfull with the speedrun achievements, but it did leave me wanting for content at the end of everything.

The scale of the van compared to the office made the game feel a little cheaper, but I liked that all of the items taken from levels were within reach even without the TK.

The story was nice, and I liked the more visible villains and enemy's but like the first I really wish that it was longer than it was.

So, overall, I liked the game, but I really want whatever the devs work on next to be a larger project with more to chew on after initial completion.

Update, I nominated this as best Vr game of 2021
 
Flameless Soul
208 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2021
Just finished the story, it took me about 3.4 hours. im going to go back for all achievements later, however i decided that i want to write my review for anyone curious about my experience

I just want to say, the amazing intro alone was one of my favorite parts. It actually had me smiling with excitement. It was a perfect start to the game.

The levels arent easy. I found myself dying and replaying the levels over and over to try and figure out how to beat it. I actually got stuck for like 20 mins trying to beat a level only to realize the answer was right under my nose. However the levels arent so hard that you want to give up, eventually you will figure it out.

My only negatives about this game so far is the $25 price tag, and how short the story is. I think that a fair price for this game is $15. (yes devs i know you and your team worked really hard for this game and it shows). But i also think that for the length of the story (only 6 levels) the price should be reduced. or just buy the game when its on sale which i was too impatient for. But keep in mind that the story isnt the only way to play it. Like going back and getting all achievements, or trying to get the fastest time on a level.

anyways its a good game and i recommend putting it on your wishlist to get notifications for when it goes on sale.

158 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 octobre 2021
Une oeuvre d'art.
Très peu de jeux ne m'ont donné un aussi bon ressenti que celui-ci. Il est ce que la VR propose de mieux.
Il s'agit d'un jeu relativement rapide a terminer, tout dépend de la manière dont on réfléchis, car il reste un jeu de réflexion.
Cependant, pour ce prix, on ne trouve pas grand chose de mieux :
-Un scénario tout simplement grandiose;
-Des musiques aux petits oignons;
-Un style artistique parfaitement adapté.
Seul bémol : le jeu n'est pas traduit en Français. Et sur ce point, il as le même problème que Skyrim : il est tellement bon que le moindre désagrément deviens une grosse épine dans le pied.
Malgré tout, je le recommande vivement, c'est un 10/10 pour moi.
Sachez seulement, que si vous ne comprenez pas couramment l'anglais (parlé), certaines énigmes peuvent devenir difficile voir impossibles, car elles nécessite de relever des informations dans un enregistrement.

TommyVR
2,005 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 octobre 2021
The vibe of the game is great, I love the ambiance, the characters, the story and the soundtrack. The artistic design is great, and the puzzles are quite great as well (very different from the classical "find numbers and type them" of other escape-room-like VR games).

However, I'm disappointed on a few points:

- The game can be completed in 2 to 3 hours. That's shorter than the first game, even if new missions are supposed to come.

- The last two missions are VERY SHORT (when you're in the set with JJ, and the grand finale with the elevator). While most of the early missions took me at least 25-30min to figure out, the last two were done in 10min each. It felt kind of rushed to release, and feels like parts were cut because of time constraints on the developer's end (or loss of interest). That's a bummer.

- Still no translations, nor at least English subtitles. While I'm very fluent in English, my girlfriend is not, and I've had to do live translations for her, otherwise she wouldn't have been able to play the game at all, as some very important intel is delivered through voice exclusively. Even just English subtitles at the bottom of the view would've made it possible for her to play the game by herself.

If you can live with that and assume that 3 hours is worth 20 bucks, then you should definitely buy this game, and I'll recommend it if you're fluent enough in English. If not, maybe wait for a sale, or wait until they actually add more missions and subtitles. I guess so far, it's a hidden "early access" game.
 
[0uverta] XpLoD

Overall fun without being too frustrating.

153 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2021
Still great, but not as good as the original.
Dont get me wrong, this game still absolutely drips in sauce; but now that the incredible originality of the first game has faded its just not the same. This is like an 8/10 game where the first one was a 10/10. The puzzles dont feel more difficult but they do feel more "fiddly" for some reason. Its easier to accidentally kill yourself a lot of the time in this game when compared to the first, not because you didnt know the threat was there, but because the fiddly nature of VR makes you fail a precise movement and you die. The story of this game is more relevant and just overall better than the first game, and I hear if you're using Oculus this game performs better than the first but on Vive both games perform well.
I'd recommend trying the first game before trying this one though, I think overall the first game was better.
 
Kellik
277 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

The VR market may be a bit slim pickings right now...however...I can assure you this is a solid title for anyone that likes goofy humor and escape room type puzzles. If you've played the first I Expect You To Die, this'll be easy. More of the same with better visuals and more intricate (but not too complex) puzzles.

Pros:
The visuals are stylized, but not in an overly cartoony way. Not that it's a bad thing. But visually, there's some pretty sweet textures for me to gawk at in VR. More importantly, there's lots of little details from rain on a window to the little bits and nods of humor in the game that you can appreciate if you're exploring your surroundings.

The puzzles are fairly simple, but occasionally head scratching. Balanced. As all things should be... Anyhow, there's some moments where you're pretty much just blitzing through the easy parts and the narrator is catching up to you and others you're sitting there trying to piece it all together. This lead to a solid 5 hours of gametime for a single playthrough. There are speedrunning opportunities here and multiple solutions to puzzles, but ultimately, this is roughly where your playtime will sit.

Music is pretty swanky though.

♥♥♥♥
I think there are a couple of little tidbits that I struggled with for puzzles just because I tried to do things in an unconventional way. So I'd get stuck for awhile and once I found the solution I'd think "huh...why would I think to do that?" I'm sure most people stumble upon this, but there's logical reasons to not do it too.

The playtime to cost ratio is maybe a wee bit high, however I felt like it's worth it's price in quality. I've paid $60 for 8 hr games like Uncharted and love them dearly because the experience and quality was worth it. At the end of the day, this game made me laugh and have several "Ah hah!" moments that were fun.
 
SpeedAsian

ZUKEtheGOOCH
123 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 septembre 2021
Gameplay

I Expect You To Die 2 offers some of the best Virtual Reality experiences and game play you can find in 2021 at the moment. From Picking up a clipboard and blocking bolts from a crossbow and turning around and using them, to punching buttons to order food and cutting off the antagonists with a directors clapper board, I Expect You To Die 2 leaves little to be desired. Each mission has its own theme and nothing really feels repetitive or Overused. Within the missions are you challenged in different ways and you are very much rewarded for speed running and trying new things.

Lock And Load, Agent

Comfort And Controls – Schell Games prioritizes comfort over everything else and it really shows. You don’t have to move much at all and all the movement is twisting and turning. This game is great for handicap people who cannot stand or otherwise. There is not much leaning at all and you do not burn a lot of energy vs games like Onward and Legendary Tales. Overall your comfort is their highest priority and saves you a lot of energy.

Relax Agent, We Have Everything Under Control

Level Design

All 6 levels are easy to play and just as easy to memorize, even for those with terrible memory. Repetition is mastery and you will find yourself learning the levels quickly as you play around with things around the level and discover some very nice hidden scenes and sequences. You will just have to discover some of them for yourself!

Final Thoughts

I expect you to die 2 is a high quality, well developed game built on the Unity Engine and is very much worth any price you pay from full price to on sale. Even though I have not 100 percent the game by any means, it is well worth the experience for the first play though, and it will leave you wanting more, and I am hoping for some DLC, otherwise we might be waiting another 5 years for a third installment of I expect you to die. This game gets a 10/10 in my books and I highly recommend this to any age group and anyone!
 
GamesWithGregVR
145 produits enregistrés
0

An improvement on the first game! As a Reverb G2 player, this game has the controls finally mapped to be working correctly, as opposed to the first where you had to "tug" an object towards you. The puzzles were fresh and different than the first, and had their own charm to them. A little more serious tone than the first, but only slightly. My only gripe is how short the game is, so I'd recommend buying when its on sale; but if you're a fan of the first and can't wait, then by all means, pull the trigger.

Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2021
Better than the previous game. Has full oculus controllers support, more intricate and detailed levels and puzzles. I still don't like the idea of replaying levels from the start though. There are a lot of collectibles, some are exclusive depending on the way you dispose of the enemies, but by the time you finish the level - you have tried and died so many times that you kinda don't want to replay the level again. Still, just as with the previous game - the main point is that it is fun, so it gets a pass.

321 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2021
Definitely get it if you played and enjoyed the first one. This time around there's a continuous story as opposed to just being disjointed single levels, which was definitely a big plus. I also really enjoyed each of the levels and their items, mechanics, etc. The new opening sequence was very cool (that was a big highlight of the first one so I'm glad they made another). The game is definitely more of the best parts of the first one. That said, like the first one it's not terribly long. I'm sure I'll come back around to replay it, but as of writing I have 100%ed the game at 7 hours of playtime (and I spent an hour being too stupid to figure one thing out on the second level)
 
MaeelJ
317 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2021
This is one of the best VR franchises there is. Like the first game it's perfectly executed to be accessible to new VR players, non-gamers, escape-room lovers, etc, but also challenging and enjoyable for even heavy gamers.

For £20 though it needs way more content. I would be happy with a 4 hour campaign, plus a bunch of additional escape rooms built by re-using assets, or even just Steam Workshop support so the community can provide this. But £20 for 4 hours of play is not great value.

I recommend the game, but unless you're a huge fan of this series or just want to support the creators, I would buy on sale.

This game is what a sequal is suppose to be, an improvment on the first with new fresh ideas but not so much better so it over shadows the first one. The actual gameplay is decent and takes alot of attension to detail to find clues and other tips to help you. You get about 4 hours of gameplay if your an average vr player that doesnt play alot of puzzle games. So in conclusion 1. its a good vr puzzle game 2. it has new fresh levels compared to the first one 3. its well priced at 20 euros

Great game, great soundtrack, amazing intro.

Owlinated
215 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2021
The game is good.

I was slightly let down compared to the first game. It's better than the first game, but we've had 4 years of VR games and IEYTD was one of the first incredible games I played on the original Vive. I was hoping this would be MUCH better, but I still enjoyed the game.

Opening credits scene still top notch. You got Wil Wheaton (I guess he sings??). Puzzles were complex enough, some a little too easy, nothing as hard as the submarine level in the first game. I found myself breezing through most of each puzzle and getting *stuck* for 30-40 minutes on something. Whole game took me about 5.5 hours according to steam, but I did replay a few levels to try and get the souvenirs. The souvenirs also need better hints because I eventually stopped trying..

Story is vastly improved from the first game. WW does a good job the whole way through.

I thought the environments/settings could be better. I LOVED the first zone so the next few were let downs. It was super interactive and I felt like I was part of the "play".

The game is still absolutely worth playing if you like puzzle games. It's up to you if the short length is worth full price.

I Expect You To Die 2, is a challenging escape room VR experience. You become an elite super-spy who is ready for espionage, explosives, and gadgets galore.

I see no faults in this game aside from the occasional hair pulling but hey that's escape games for you. The graphics are fantastic, the challenges are challenging.

Would recommend 10/10
 
ninjakiller560
814 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2021
As with the first game, this is a fantastic VR game, though also like it's predecessor it's a little short. Only BARELY this time though!

The writing is taken up a notch this time, with fully voiced antagonists in every level and a more coherent story between levels over the first games more general "there is a bad guy" story. There was never a problem with the latter's story, but it's nice to see the narrative get a boost.

The telepathic control scheme is back and utilised just as effectively. There's more you can play with in each level too! You're also able to interrupt and skip dialogue cues and events if you either figure it out fast enough or simply know what you're doing and speed through. It can actually get quite funny in certain levels.

This fantastic sequel has only just came out and the first got some updates that added to it, so i look forward to seeing what might be in stpore for this espionage escapade in the future.

fatigue
463 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2021
You find yourself trapped on a murder-plane 40,000 feet in the air. The service cart delivers you a delicious chocolate cake. Knowing better than to eat the obviously poison dessert you instead grab the silver platter and use it to deflect a laser beam suddenly aimed at your face. With expert precision you maneuver the reflected beam to destroy the other traps in the cabin.

You lean back with a satisfied look on your face and click open your lighter to enjoy a celebratory cigar. It explodes. You die. You should have expected that.
 
Oshyer
767 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2021
If you are new to VR, this series is a must have. With intuitive gameplay that's easy to learn and fun to experiment in, this game and it's predecessor are excellent introduction to the medium and will leave you hungry for more.

I Expect You To Die 2 absolutely delivers on it's promise of more great, flexible puzzles and improves upon many aspects from the original (My favorite addition? Multiple save files). The hidden collectibles make you feel smart for figuring out a secret interaction, and the speedrun achievements feel difficult but never out of your reach. At the time of writing, I have only played for a short amount of time, and this is my feelings directly after finishing the game. However, I feel these thoughts will not be changing in the near future.

The soundtrack this time around is a direct improvement. The dynamic songs that shift in intensity as the level progresses really make you feel like you're in a James Bond movie, especially in the second stage. The opening for this game is a stunning performance by my favorite character in the game's voice actor, wonderfully setting the tone for the rest of the game. The first game's opening was a wonderful experience as a new VR user, and now, even with years using VR actively, this intro surpasses it in every way.

The introduction of actual characters in view, depicted as silhouettes with white eyes, adds a lot more tension. The only "on-screen" character in the original was never even given that much, so it gave this game a fresh identity and improved the feeling of being in enemy territory substantially. The writing this time around is very good as well, with some very entertaining characters that are that much more compelling than in the original game.

This next section will have spoilers in it, so if the tag fails, this is your warning. The antagonist of this game, Juniper, wasn't exactly a surprise due to the opening spelling it out. However, as an antagonist, they turn out to be compelling regardless, his dialogue on the plane setting him up to be a gloating figure in love with cheesy lines. He's so full of himself, and yet he still becomes an intimidating figure due to his tangible talent as an actor, and as a result they are much more fleshed out and fun to challenge than Zoraxis plans were in my opinion. Hopefully the next continuation of the story gives some love towards the Fabricator as well. And if he is indeed still around after the end of the game as the board implies, then where his character will go next will be of utmost interest.

Overall, IETD2 is a sequel that lives up to, and surpasses, the original in every way. Bravo, Schell Games, for outdoing yourselves once again, and I will absolutely be ready for what comes next.
 
MaddiMuffins
213 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.3 h en tout

Let me tell you, this game was worth every single penny, and the story was also really cool. The puzzles were challenging and took me a while to get, but they weren't so difficult that I had to look up a walk through. Overall I give this game a 12/10.

Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2021
Really enjoyed this, if you played the first game, it really is just more of that (which is a good thing). Same kinda early VR wacky humor feeling. Puzzles weren't too hard, they were reasonable. The couple times I felt the need to pull up a guide were usually cause I had missed something (like sending something up on a dumbwaiter and getting sent back a key that I hadn't seen). So the difficulty is reasonable, but you'll have to think outside the box a little bit.

If you enjoyed the first game, totally pick this up. You won't be disappointed.

Recommandé
11.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2021
Годный сиквел! Не пожалел, что купил. Но есть пару недостатков. Игра лишком короткая, и как мне показалось, не оч интерактивная, как первая часть. И второй недостаток это отсутствие банальных субтитров, хотя бы английских, ибо воспринимать на слух оч тяжко (в первой части их тож не было). В игре есть сюжет полноценно связный сюжет, но.. к сожалению, из за своего скудного знания английского понял только основную суть, но было бы интересно послушать те же отдельные диалоги (Было пару миссий где нужно оч много слушать и выполнять, прошёл чисто на рандоме, но всё же.. неприятненько... Если Вы владеете нормальным уровнем английского (или хоть как то можете его воспринимать на слух (не то, что я)), то рекомендую к покупке, ну и так же тем, кому понравилась первая часть)
П.С. Вступительное интро 1000/10
 
⎠⎞Rock⎛⎝
367 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2021
More of the same and this could basically be an IEYTD1 DLC-pack except for a couple of tweaks to the controls.
That isn’t a bad thing though because the first game is still on my top-5 list of favorite VR games!
For the price of 20€ it’s a bit thin when it comes to content with me playing through the game in about 3 hours (and NO, I will not call doing a second playthrough to find all hidden items additional “content”) but I will still recommend this title to anyone who enjoys puzzle games…
Another great thing about this game is the fact that it’s designed for seated play and that makes it a perfect game to start with if you are new to VR since you are less likely to get motion sickness…
I hope they will keep the DLC coming for this title!
 
HaraKiN
180 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2021
The price for this game is borderline too much, but the extra secrets per level add replay-ability that it sorely needs. The game is great, the humor on point, the music is catchy, and the villain is great. The levels are not too hard that you need a guide, but hard enough that you will not get it first try. All the levels are unique and fun, making for no "bad" levels.

There are 6 levels in total, which is why I think it is somewhat hard to justify the $25 price tag, but the levels are so good that it nudges my review to a positive.

コーヒー
275 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2021
A great addition to the "I Expect You To Die" series, and proof positive that Schell Games is still top of the VR Escape Room/Puzzle game. Wil Wheaton steals the show in this game.

I do miss some of the banter dialogue that was in the first game when finding souvenirs, and the game sticking to a single story thread almost seemed limiting at times compared to the more episodic nature of the first game. However, there's no question that this is a fantastic entry into the series, and should not be missed.

this game is amazing, its good if you dont know the story it will be good but if you know the story its going to be a thousand times better, not dissapointed. the levels are a bit confuzing but once you figured them out its really fun. 10/10 worth all of the money, get it
 
kongtron
235 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2021
I was initially on the fence due to the price tag but this turned out to be one of the best story-puzzle games I've played since Lone Echo and IEYTD 1. Awe inspiring cinematics and fabulous story. The opening credits alone deserves to give this GOTY. The voice acting makes you feel like you ARE the agent and the music is good enough to listen to on its own. Puzzles are challenging enough that you struggle but doable even by poor puzzle solvers with enough effort. Only 6 missions but they're one hell of a pack of missions, featuring just as much content in 6 jobs as the previous game did in (8? was it?). Similarly to the first game there's plenty of achievements and collectibles to go back for if you're into that. If you're on the questioning whether or not to buy this game, Do it. And, Good Luck Agent.

stabbypssm
130 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2021
This is much closer to a negative review than I was expecting. It's still positive on the whole, partially because I don't think my main issue will be a problem for any future levels, but I can't say I wasn't disappointed.

So most of the game is great. The first game is one of my favorite VR games, and this is mostly more of that. The levels feel a bit less detailed than the first, but not to a level where it feels cheap. Controls are great, being seated the whole time makes locomotion a non-issue. The puzzles are good, and I only encountered a few bugs.

But the main villain is FAR too annoying for a game where you have to replay levels to find secrets. It's fine to have a hateable villain, but have him hateable for the things he does, not his smug slimy voice. The fact that the game seems to act like he's some super likable person makes this even worse. I hoped he would just be in one level but he's there for almost the whole game, and I don't know if I can collect the secrets if I have to listen to him over and over.

This sounds like a small thing, and if you can stand him, great, but it made me think about quitting every time he showed up in a scene.
 
Koriar
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2021
like the first game, it is somewhat short, but it is pretty fun to go back and get all the achievements, figuring out how to do all the missions in the speedrun time is a difficult puzzle itself. This and the first game are the best puzzle VR games I've played, and this one was even better in a lot of ways, like the story is much better for example. Definitely recommend.

Its just like the first game, this is what seated VR games should be like, fun interaction and story, found this game a little easier than the first and I've completed it in a hour and 20 min so I'm a little disappointed its over already, will take me longer to find all the secrets and do all the speed runs though, look forward to DLC or extra free levels, if not hope they make a number 3 as this kind of VR experience never gets old, only thing I wish to change about the game is more smoke from the cigar, not sure why but I loved puffing on the cigar in the first game, didn't feel like I could get a good drag on it in this one, maybe they where cheep knock off's lol.
Played on the Rift S, Ryzen 7 3800X, (AMD- MSI-TRIO) 6800XT, 32 DG Ram XMP 3200, Windows 10 64, no problems.

Wolf.
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2021
Das Warten auf Teil 2 hat sich gelohnt!

Bereits von Teil 1 war ich mehr als begeistert und auch hier nicht enttäuscht. Das Spiel hat eine super Story, die an die Vorherige anknüpft und sich durch alle Level zieht. Die Level an sich sind gut durchdacht erstellt worden und bieten an vielen Stellen nicht nur einen gutes Rätselerlebnis sondern auch viele Möglichkeit, rumzuspielen.
Obwohl ich die Story nach bereits 2,9 Stunden durchgespielt habe, sehe ich den Preis dennoch als gerechtfertigt an. Es gibt, wie auch im ersten Teil, die Möglichkeit, das Level in einem Speedrun zu beenden oder Eastereggs zu finden, weshalb man die Level durchaus öfter als ein Mal spielen kann.
Da auch dieser Teil mit einer Art Cliffhanger endet, freue ich mich bereits auf den (hoffentlich erscheinenden) 3. Teil und werde diesen auch mit Sicherheit erwerben.
Eine kleine Updateidee meinerseits zum Schluss: Mir fehlt eine Errungenschaft, alle möglichen Tode in einem Level gefunden zu haben. Dies würde das Spiel nochmal auf eine andere Ebene befördern und vor allem hat man so den Anreiz, so dumm wie nur irgendwie möglich zu denken, was meiner Meinung nach viel Spaß bereiten würde.

Goobness Graciousness
195 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2021
If you liked the first one, you'll like this one too. If you haven't played the first one, I recommend buying it instead.

This game adds a lot more story and cohesion between the levels compared to the first one. The story, humor, and puzzles were really fun. Wheaton's performance as Juniper is great, although I don't personally care for the star. The puzzles felt easier than the first one. I'm really bad at puzzle games and often need an external guide, but I only had to look for info once. I had a lot of fun playing IEYTD2, But to be honest, I just liked the levels from the first game more.

The game has basic Index support, but it's not great. Sometimes (rarely) things you're grabbing fall, and there's no fingertracking at all (except for the thumb, and only tracks if you touch the joystick, not the other buttons.)

Good✅

Story

Good Story❌
Epic Story✅

Story lengh

Short 1-3Hours✅
Little bit longer than short 4-6 Hours❌
Average 7-11 Hous❌
Long 15-100 Hours❌

Loading Times

short✅
average❌
long❌
invinite and above❌

Characters
Kids❌
Teens❌
Adults✅

PC Specs

Old PC from My Grandma❌
Potato ❌
Fast ✅
Rich Boiiii❌
Ask NASA for a PC❌T

Preis

Too cheap❌
Worth it✅

Total Waste of Money❌

Bugs:
Never heard of Bugs❌
Minior Bugs✅
Sehr verbuggt❌

Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2021
沒什麼好說的 就是精彩
場景多樣 並且新增了很多間諜電影的經典橋段
若說一代像是007 那二代就像是不可能的任務

某些地方難度跟一代比有略微下降
跟一代相較之下時間限制較長、比較不吃快速反應 玩家可以不用手忙腳亂的解謎
不過變的比較吃英聽 要聽指示操作過關

miskobinesi
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2021
두 번째 타이틀로 돌아온 VR 스파이 게임.
현재 6스테이지까지 있고 가격에 비해 플레이 타임이 짧지만 무척 재미있다.
힌트를 대놓고 줘서 영어 듣기가 된다면 수월하게 클리어할 수 있는데, 영어가 안돼도 눈치껏 클리어 가능.
바이브 기준 왼쪽 컨트롤러 메뉴 버튼을 꾹 누르면 리스타트와 게임 나가기를,
오른쪽 컨트롤러 메뉴 버튼을 꾹 누르면 시점 초기화를 할 수 있음.


본격적인 게임 시작은 라디오를 키고 주파수를 맞춰 나오는 테이프를 삽입하면 됨.
나처럼 대충대충 넘기다가 오프닝 두세 번 보는 일은 없기를..
모두 즐겜~
